question: We're losing our biggest celebrity today. Not that slime, you Fizzhead. Hudson Hawk. The last of the great cat burglars. As a thief, Hawk was a poem. Iambic fucking pentameter. You know, Crime used to have a little class. A hundred reporters were here when he came in, now they're probably out covering some tired crack gang war...
answer: Remind me to fire my publicist.

question: Guess this means, Hawk, you'll be able to let yourself back in...
answer: Never happen. Bet. Ten bucks. Oh, give this back to Petey in A block. Tell him it was a sweet gift, but I think he got some wrong ideas about our friendship.

question: Hope I lose the bet. Have that cappuccino on me.
answer: You got it. A double.

question: Answer's no, not even if you bathe. Cesar Mario, Antony Mario, how's the "Family?" Kill any monkeys lately?
answer: How many times do I have to say it? I didn't put the hit on Little Eddie... Never had anything against that kooky chimp. I actually found him, "endearing."

question: Sure. Face down. Two endearing shots to the back of the head. That's your mark, man. What did Little Eddie ever do to...
answer: You're hitting Rutherford's Auction House. Easy as my brother's wife. Directions are in the bag. Just open the seventh floor safe and take out the thingie...

question: Hawk, you're a great thief. Got set up, did some time, nothing to be ashamed of. Don't give me a sonata about you always just really wanted to settle down, open a hardware Store and sell spatulas...
answer: If the Mario brothers weren't Jersey's third largest family, I'd say kiss my ass. But considering your status, I'll say slurp my butt.

question: What's your favorite sport, Hawk?
answer: Baseball, why? I meant, ping pong. Listen, I'd rather go back in than whore for you... Oh, I need to borrow ten dollars. Help? Police?

question: You need some time to think. That's cool, but next time, I'm not going to say "Please."
answer: I don't believe this. I've been out forty seconds...

question: I don't believe this. I've been out forty seconds...
answer: That's the first thing I did. Smooch the ground and taste the freedom. Sorry I was late. Miss anything?

question: Your timing, and your shoes, are impeccable... Good to see you, Alex, been having a lousy day.
answer: Lousy day? The man's getting out of prison and he's having a lousy day. What, you missing out on the Cell Block Water Ballet pageant? Believe me, it's overrated. Where's the kiss? No tongue this time, I promise.

question: Looks like you've been expanding your...
answer: Don't say it, Hawkins. I'm incredibly sensitive about my fucking figure.

question: My next word was gonna be "consciousness." Swear to God... tubby. That's your definition of "Hard?"
answer: Show off. Hey, boss tune. "Come Fly with Me."

question: Three minutes, 51 seconds.
answer: Still do the puzzles, still know the running times of songs, and I'll bet you're still the best damn cat burg--

question: Not anymore. Now I'm the laziest damn cat burg--I'm going to take it so straight that I won't tape a Mets game without the expressed written consent of the National Baseball League.
answer: Now that you're born again,what do you wanna do? Statue of Liberty? Entertain some ladies? Miss Saigon tix? Seduce some women? Play Nintendo? Bone some chicks?

question: Come on, Alex, let's just get to Alex's. Your bar's the only place that's going to cheer me. God, I'd kill for a damn cappuccino. What the hell's a Nintendo?
answer: Oh man, you still got a thing for those unmasculine European coffees? Who's your buddy?

question: The man knows, the man knows!
answer: So Mr. Coffee, what went down outside the prison?

question: Oh, not much. Mario Brothers want me to do a job.
answer: Those dago-guinea-I can say this shit I'm Italian-wop motherfu--

question: Ah, had the perfect amount of foam. Just get me to the bar... It's the one good thing in my life that'll never change....
answer: I didn't know how to tell you. A couple brokers stopped in for Stoley Spritzers one night. Next thing I know Fast Track Digest votes us "Watering Hole of the Month." Now, I'm shopping for Aqua Salmon wallpaper.

question: I read about these people in Newsweek. Where's all the regulars, Crazy Jeff Cava, the Todd sisters, Indian Joe? Where's Ed Kranepool's autograph? Captain Bob's steering wheel?
answer: Hey, get this irritable guy a cappuccino. I gotta go be a boss.

question: This is Pizza? Reindeer Goat cheese? I admit, I've been known to go wild and order a Canadian Bacon in my time, but.. Can you take a sunrise and sprinkle it with dew? The Candy Man can, Felix. You know, I thought this was a country where you could do any stupid thing you wanted; drive to work naked, make love to a V.C.R. Guess I'm wrong. Maybe that's why I became a serial arsonist.
answer: You're under arrest... Have a seat. Good to see you, buddy ol' pal...

question: The pleasure's all yours, Officer Gates.
answer: Why do you show your parole officer such disrespect? Especially after I got you such a nice job.

question: What job?
answer: The auction house, asshole. One night's work and you're free like no ex-con's ever been. No checking in with a shrink, no community service teaching retards how to play air hockey. It's a great deal, I can't lie.

question: The only thing you can't do is get sex for free. I know I was in prison for like basically the 80's, but, call me daffy, aren't you supposed to stop me from committing crimes. You know, Book-em-Dano, Call-for-backup, Give-a-Hoot-Don't-Pollute.
answer: You wouldn't be out if it wasn't for me! I did dog and pony for you! You think they would have let you out after what you did, you told the board members they looked like the Three Stooges...

question: How was I supposed to know they were women? Besides one of them was bald and kept saying "Soitinly."
answer: Remember that guy in the cell next to you who hung himself?

question: Yes.
answer: Remember that shoe you lost...

question: Uh, yeah. Cut to the chase.
answer: One phone call and your shoe will become a piece of evidence and that suicide'll become a murder.

question: What else do you got under there ... I don't want to be rude, but this is all pretty lame.
answer: That's the beauty. It's bullshit, but I can make it stick because I'm a good guy parole officer and you re a bad guy who's about to find out that there's a thin line between ex-con and escape con.

question: No, man, actually you are. Just add water and it makes its own gravy. Keeps your teeth healthy and your coat shiny. Hmmmm.....
answer: Yo Pandora, quit hummm-ing... look at this. It's Captain Bob's steering wheel! Remember when the Captain.....

question: Hmmm, nasty little safe on the 7th.
answer: The safe's a Simpson 71. Last time I played the game, Simpson only had a 40.

question: Just means it'll take you an extra 31 seconds to seduce. You re still the best, I know it.
answer: But you got three guards who... Shit, what am I doing? Where's the want ads? Gonna sell some spatulas.

question: Hey, I'm sorry, man. I'm putting out a fire with kerosene.
answer: This isn't funny. I'm not into this. I...

question: There goes five seconds...My record's eighteen.
answer: You're not...LISTENING! I'm sorr--Goddamn Mario Brothers. Goddamn Gates. Goddamn Rutherford Auction House. By the way, how many seconds?

question: Rutherford Auction... that name...
answer: Alex!

question: Don't wet your diapers. I'll have to change them. "Witchcraft." What's the running time?
answer: 3:48. I can't get you involved, man. This is my sewage and... God, you love all this, don't you, you bastard. Haven't you ever heard of stamp collecting, or curling?

question: I'm in. Have you seen the public service announcements for Diabetes. We can ride horses, play LaCrosse, and knock off auction houses. I got a plan. You won't have to hail Cesar or Gates.
answer: I'm a bum. Whoa, you better cut a bigger hole than that.

question: Hey, you promised......Don't worry, I'm wearing my girdle.
answer: Cameras?

question: No need. Guards' station's right there. They record everything their video surveillance takes in...
answer: Yes, master-thief, I can see that. You said something about a plan...

question: Am I boring you, smartass? Watch. A little rewind and re-wire action and the Guards are going to be watching a rerun and miss out on our exciting episode. You got about five minutes and change.
answer: 5:32. "Swinging on a Star."

question: You know they invented something while you were inside. Called a watch.
answer: "A mule is an animal with long funny ears."

question: "He kicks up at anything he hears.
answer: "Or would you rather swing on a star, carry moonbeams home in a jar."

question: swing on a star, carry moonbeams...
answer: "Or would you rather be a fish?" spits on the rubber cup of an electronic sensor, plugged into a Walkman, and affixes it to the safe above the dial. "A fish is annuh nan na nan na brook.

question: "He can't write his name or read a book. To fool people is his only thought."
answer: "And though he's slippery, he still gets caught." "And all the monkeys aren't in the zoo."

question: "Every day you meet quite a few." The song's over! Come on! "You could be swinging on a star."
answer: What am I doing here? There are so many things I wanna do that aren't this. Paint a lighthouse. Kiss a woman in Italy.

question: "You could be swinging on a star."
answer: Paint a woman in a lighthou--I don't want to steal a horse. Life is... Let's go down the freight elevator.

question: Keep those ideas coming. I'm not as unpleasantly plump as that Guard am I.
answer: I can't even swim.

question: So when's that Sebastian-Cabot- Buckingham-Palace-looking- Butlerhead getting here?
answer: Any minute now, dear Mr. Gates.

question: Oh, sorry Jeeves. Gates-arita?
answer: I'll pass. May I? Ah, such craftsmanship. Leonardo Da Vinci's last commission for the Duke of Milan. Irreplaceable.

question: Hey, Mr. French, I'm delirious for you. Now where's my cut? You son-of-a......I don't believe this! You come into my house! I ought to take Big Ben and shove it up your limey blimey bunghole! Like I said. Where's my cu-u-...
answer: So much for his "cut." Excuse my dry British humor.

question: Too-do-loo, babe.
answer: Did I miss anything?

question: Oh, not much. Gates just had his tonsils taken out. The hard way.
answer: Geez, Gates was killed. Who do we send the thank you note to?

question: The Butler did it. Guy was a cross between Alistair Cook and a Cuisinart. Dude took Mr. Ed and humptied dumptied it over Gates's head. He said it was made by, get this, Leonardo..
answer: Ah yes, a rare Renaissance piece. Da Vinci's "Sforza," an equestrian model of a never executed statue. I consider it to be the prize of tonight's auction of objets d'equestrian. Horse things.

question: Okay, you got me, Mr. PBS.
answer: Morning edition. Seems two thieves "attempted" to steal it last night, but thanks to three "courageous" guards, it will be ready for tonight.

question: "Attempted." At-tempt-ted! I'm not happy about having to steal that horse, but I do have my pride. Face it, when it comes to burglary, and sex, I.... Boing. Uh, this I don t understand...
answer: Why try?

question: Because I'm tired of not understanding things. Cops, Mafia, and butlers forcing me to bust my ass to steal something, which it turns out I really didn't steal--it's fucked up.
answer: You re not thinking of going to...

question: Alex, my man, it's time to play a little offense. Where's your tux?
answer: ...fan-taas-tic example of Florentine marble... Who will start at 160,000...160,000......180,000.

question: All these years of attending auctions, I still get goosebumps. The paintings, the sculptures....the things that aren't really paintings or sculptures... I couldn't agree more. Savages.
answer: Lot Fifteen, an equestrian sconce attributed to the Cellini school.. Sold! To the caller from Newfoundland.

question: Is looking like a constipated warthog a prerequisite to getting a job in the art world?
answer: There have naturally been questions of its authenticity, so to verify we have Doctor Anna Baragli of the Vatican. Doc?

question: My God, that was bold of you, you didn't have to do that...
answer: Forget about it--it was nothing-- anybody would have done the same thing--It's an impulse...

question: No, I meant you didn't have to tackle me and rip my dress. A polite push, perhaps? A clear shout of "watch out, Anna" would have done nicely...
answer: Excuse me, Milady. I would have flown over and carried you up to a pink cloud, but I left my cape at the cleaners.

question: Thanks tough guy, thanks a lot. Why was the guard chasing you?
answer: Because Danger, Doc, is my middle... Saint Pete, hey I know, the whole cat burglar thing, it sounds bad, but I'll take the worst cloud you got...

question: I call them the MTV.I.A. Punks think Bay of Pigs is an herbal tea. They think the Cold War involves penguins and...
answer: Don't I know you...

question: You just might. I'm the guy who tricked you into robbing a government installation and then had you sent to prison for it. At the time, I was bald with a beard, no moustache, and I had a different nose, so if you don't recognize me, I won't be offended.
answer: Bastard, you're going to need another nose! But I'm not the type of guy to hold a grudge.

question: I used you as a diversion. while you were getting captured upstairs, I was shredding documents in the basement. Deep down, I guess I was just jealous. You were one incredible thief...
answer: To what do I owe the dishonor of a reunion, you centrally intelligent scumsicle.

question: I Want to make things up to you. That's why I got you this gig, doll. Hawk, my name's George Kaplan and to quote the late, great Karen Carpenter, "We've only just begun."
answer: Three minutes, twenty-three seconds. If you think I'm doing another...

question: Hush. My employer wants a meeting.
answer: Employer? The president?

question: No, somebody powerful. Oh. Look. what's that up there?
answer: I'm supposed to fall for that?

question: Shucks. Guess not.
answer: No. Way.

question: Yes way.
answer: For those kind of wages, I could have built the factory in America! They're Vietnamese, can't we just give them more Bart Simpson shirts? I hear depressing news like this and I want to commit genocide! Alfred, hold my calls. So, Hawk! The Hawkster! What do you think of the vehicle?

question: You could host American Bandstand in here. Why did you duck at the auction, asshole?
answer: Because I didn't want to get hurt, taterhead. What can I tell you, I'm the villain. Initially it was a priority to keep a lot of buffers between you and me, but since most of them are dead now, I thought what the heck. Hawk, you come highly recommended. I would have done some things differently at the auction house, but hey, I want to be in business with you.

question: I'm sorry, I have to take this. Those are valid points though... You better have a good excuse... You better have a better excuse! You are so weak! I'm only thankful your ancestors didn't settle America or else my name would be Running Brave or Vomiting Antelope...Really. Well, listen close, babe. Shall we? So Hawkasaurus, I won't mince words...
answer: Whatever. You own Boardwalk, you own Park Place, you own the four railroads. You think you're God. For all I know, you're probably right. I just wanted to have a damn cappuccino, maybe play some Nintendo after I find out what it is. Man, why didn't you just buy the horse? What am I saying, you did buy it...

question: Oh... Let's see. There are organizations that think we wanted the "Sforza" for reasons other than putting it in the Da Vinci museum we're building in Vinci. Hopefully, these organizations think our plan has been ruined with the explosion of our replica. If I seem vague, grand. We want a low profile on this, that's why I got Kaplan and the Candy bars involved. I helped George help the Mario Brothers and Gates help get you out....
answer: If you're pausing for a "thank you," give it up. So boss, you going to tell me what the crystal piece inside the pony means?

question: Way to go, Alfie! How many people did you break that thing in front of. Good help's hard to find.
answer: I guess that's a no.

question: That's two hundred dollars a day? So he can get a hooker and some tequila. Veto, Darwin.
answer: Guess I know who wears the penis in this family.

question: For God's sake, chain this convict.
answer: Alfred, you're a very polite psychopath, but if you...

question: I'm robbing the Vatican. The nuns at St. Agnes predicted that I'd end up doing this... Excuse me, I'm being blackmailed into robbing the Vatican by a psychotic American corporation along with a CIA... Forget it, man. Go tackle a jaywalker. Operator, I want to make a collect call to Alex Messina, New York....
answer: But it is his gift as an inventor who drew together science and art that is most incredible. Tough guy. What are you--How's your head.

question: Yes, and my giraffe loves it, too...
answer: As you know, the Da Vinci Codex, has lived in the Vatican for centuries and will continue to live here for centuries more.

question: That's what you theenk.
answer: Question, sir? His untiring pen predicted the airplane, the submarine, the bicycle, the helicopter, and even the tank. These more dangerous designs inspired him to develop a secret code that .... Come on, this stuff will knock you out. Have you ever had the feeling you were being followed, Mr. Bond.

question: Never, why do you ask? Whoa. Name's Hawkins, Eddie Hawkins. My nickname's Hudson Hawk, but don't call me Hudson, not even as a joke. The Nuns at St. Agnes called me that and they're the ones who helped make me what I am today. Not a compliment...
answer: Sure Hudson. Are you going to tell me why you did that back there or are you going to blame it on Dumbo?

question: Could you believe that crazy elephant? Whoa, part 2. Does it go to Times Square?
answer: Delivers up to ten at night. The Pope has an obsession with his Easter Seals. It's actually not that an unusual set-up. The secret passageway on the other hand....

question: The Vatican is made of constant mysteries meant to be enjoyed, not explained.
answer: Nice. But right out of our brochure.

question: Oh, you read that.
answer: Actually I wrote it. It's a good sentence. It can apply to people.

question: You're not an unmysterious thang yourself.
answer: I don't steal stuffed elephants from little girls. And I buy my own clothes. My life's a little boring...

question: God, I wish I could say the same thing. What about having a nice, dull dinner with me tonight. Scrabble, Knock-knock jokes, Anecdotes about famous dead Italians....
answer: I'll bring my entire repertoire...

question: And I'll bring my entourage...
answer: Secret passageways don't mean as much as they used to. There's a place two blocks east of here. Enzo's. Say 10:30.

question: Said.
answer: Father, it's obvious. He's up to something. Yes, sir.

question: Father, it's obvious. He's up to something. Yes, sir.
answer: Did he mention the Mayflowers?

question: No, your Eminence. I think he's going to steal the Codex, as early as next week.
answer: Attempt, you mean. The vanity of this man, Hudson Hawk. The Vatican has foiled the advances of Pirates and Terrorists. We will not lie down for some schmuck from New Jersey. Must you flirt with him so realistically?

question: That's the best kind. A wise woman once said "Polite conversation is rarely either."
answer: Let me be the one to quote Scripture. ....As an agent of our organization, you are put in awkward situations. Just remember, Hudson Hawk is an evil, evil man.

question: Snickers, make the list happen. Oh and it's one thing to play hide and seek with the Mayflower's pathetic staff, but we're sore losers. I've put jumper cables on the nipples of children and not always in the line of duty.
answer: Thanks for sharing.

question: We blow up space shuttles for breakfast. You and your friend Alex would be a late afternoon Triscuit.
answer: If you do anything to my friend...

question: Yeah, right. By the way, as long as I'm getting things off my chest, I'm the one who killed your little monkey. Made it look like a Mafia hit. Did it for fun. Ciao.
answer: What did you have against Little Eddie, motherfucker? He was just a monkey who liked to laugh. Come back without your yuppie army. I'll triscuit you, you space shuttle eating...Shit.!

question: Come on, Pierre, Steak-bur-ger, Fren-n-ch Fries. This is France, you gotta have French.....
answer: Actually we're in Italy, Snickers, she said as if it made a difference.

question: Italy, France, Moscow. They all just wanna be Nebraska. Old Man Kaplan thinks since Communism is dead, we got nothing to do. Man, Democracy isn't free elections. We gotta teach the world that Democracy is Big Tits, College Football on Saturdays, Eddie Murphy saying the word "Fuck" and Kids putting their hands down garbage disposals on "America's Funniest Home Videos."
answer: Damn baby, when's the last time you had a vacation...Jesus, I gotta get out of this job. If my Mom knew her daughter assassinated the leader of the anti-Apartheid movement....

question: This is bueno. They had the worst ketchup in prison.....uh...
answer: Prison?

question: I was the Warden?
answer: How long were you in?

question: Let's just say, I never saw E.T.
answer: Wow, you were "in the joint." "Doing hard time." It's funny, but that excites me. I seem to have a thing for sinners.

question: I seem to have a thing for sinning. sinning. Check please....
answer: Yes. Something to go.

question: I'll bring the ketchup.
answer: What have you been doing?

question: Uh....old badminton injury. tickles, ticKleS, TICKLES.
answer: Oh, I'm so sorry... I'm sorry. I can't. I....

question: Hey now, outside of a very friendly dog this morning, it's been a slow decade. I don't make love every ten years, I get a little cranky.
answer: It's also been a long time for me. I--

question: Catholic girls are scary...
answer: Somebody robbed the Vatican.

question: Oh. No. It's not what you think. Okay, maybe it is....
answer: You really went and did it. With one day, not even a day, of planning, you did it. Nobody does it better, Hudson. You started the week stealing the Sforza and you ended it swiping the Codex.

question: Wha--
answer: What are your plans for the weekend? Hoisting away the Colosseum? Tell me, did the devil make you do it or did Darwin and Minerva Mayflower?

question: Way to go, Anna.
answer: When the Mayflowers find out we have the Codex, they're going to want to make a deal...

question: And then we'll arrest those greedy pigs... Is that it?
answer: Actually George, it's not it. What are we doing in this castle? I happen to know the Mayflowers bought this castle last year when they found out Da Vinci used to do...

question: It's the site of their new museum and we're taking it over. Operation Deflower Mayflower is going full speed ahead.
answer: Oh Lord.... the only reason I ask is that Hudson, uh, Mr. Hawk, Hawkins, had some "neat" things to say about Darwin, Minerva, and you. Basically that you're part of the same car pool.

question: Anna. Anna. Anna. If that were true, Almond Joy would have handed you your heart right after you handed me the Codex. Now, get some sleep. Kit Kat...
answer: Cat got his tongue?

question: Actually he never told us what it was.
answer: How sweet. I trust you will see Hudson Hawk is given to the proper authorities. I recommend leniency...

question: Forgive me Father for I have sinned. It's been 1200 hours since my last confession.
answer: Hit me with your best shot.

question: I betrayed a man. A good man. An innocent man. A thief.
answer: Anna, what are you trying to say...

question: He came into a world where crime is a legitimate business tactic and a legitimate government procedure. But he knew Right and Wrong. Oh, and we kind of messed around...
answer: "Messed around" messed around? I know-- I don't want to know. First base? Second Base? Stop me when I'm getting warm...

question: A little petting is not the issue!
answer: Sorry. Seventeen Hail Marys and five minutes outside. So let me get this straight, sister, you're saying Hudson Hawk is not willingly working for the Mayflowers but Kaplan and the Candy Bars are?

question: You got it. Operation Deflower Mayflower is a bad joke and I'm the punchline. I thought we were using the CIA to help us to get Mayflower, but really the CIA was using me to keep us away from Mayflower.
answer: Oh, why couldn't I be the Cardinal in charge of catering.... If the Mayflowers get the three sections of Da Vinci's crystal and his instructions for the gold machine-- Aie-yi--Do we got anything? What of Alex, Hawk's friend, where is his loyalty?

question: I'm going to find out.
answer: I'm sorry for losing it back there, but you must remember, sister, you have vows to God as well as a mission to the world.

question: I know, I know, your Eminence, just say "God go with me."
answer: God go with you, sister.

question: It was so beautiful! When the blanks went off, they...
answer: You bastard. You fucked my freedom for a lousy job.

question: But I said I was sorry....
answer: No sweat, Alex, you only made the biggest mistake of my life. What was your per-diem?

question: Hudson, don't you understand...
answer: And you, Dr. Cappucino, you're lucky I don't hit women, assuming you are a woman. I'm not taking anything for granted anymore.

question: I-work-for-a-covert-Vatican-humanitarian- organization. The-CIA-made-a-fool-of-me. I-care-for-you...
answer: Oh. Well, what's this?

question: Where did you get this?
answer: You know, the place where you gave the bad guys the Codex.... the Mayflower Museum.

question: It's from the machine. All they need is the crystal to run it and they have 2/3 of it already. We can't let that happen.
answer: You're saying you want us to beat them to the crystal and save the world from financial disarray.

question: Something like that.
answer: Well, forget about it. Hawk and I are going to Rio. We're hurt, we're tired, and a hero ain't nothing but a sandwich. Right, buddy?...

question: Hudson, God's given you a gift for cat burglary, you can t just...
answer: You better believe I can. I'm sick of people telling me what I have to do.

question: It's that kind of selfish attitude that...
answer: Selfish attitude? I'm just some guy who wants a little nap and a cappuccino for when he wakes up, not too much foam...

question: You re not "some guy" anymore, Hudson. Right now, you're the only guy. Without your help, I....
answer: The world is beautiful. Every day in prison I made sure to remember that. It's only when I actually got out that I forgot. If I was sane, I'd be on that plane to Rio. But being beaten and abused to fulfill some corporation's perverted vision does something to your mental health. The world is beautiful and I'm tired of being fucked. It's Darwin and Minerva's turn to bite the pillow...

question: Oh, honey.... We did it man, we...
answer: Oh Hudson...

question: I told you not to call me Hudson. The only people who called me that were the nuns at...
answer: Oh Hudson, I'm a sister of the Catholic church as well as an agent.

question: She killed Alex.
answer: GOLD-FI-ING-ER! Sorry, I couldn't resist. You're probably wondering why you're still alive. Anna..... I want you to monitor the Da Vinci's directions from the apprentice diary. And Hawk, I didn't want you to go to hell without knowing that Darwin and I's dream came true. Beside that, none of us can seem to put that damn crystal together. Alfie and I were up all night with the thing.

question: You killed a friend. Why should I help you go for the gold?
answer: It'll take a couple of years of steady production, but I'll flood the market with so much gold that gold itself, the foundation of all finance, will lose its meaning. Brokers, economists, and fellow entrepreneurs will drown in the saliva of their own nervous breakdowns. Markets will crash- crash. Financial Empires will crumble-crumble.

question: Except yours-yours. The goal of world domination. Well, if you put it that way, Minnie. How can I resist?
answer: You can't, convict! You're just a shmoe! Every shmoe has the fantasy the planet revolves around them. It rains, car crash stops traffic, you say "How could this happen to me?" It's a natural inclination. But for I, this isn't a fantasy, it is reality! You are on my planet! You walk around the corner for coffee, out of my sight, you do not fucking exist! The lives of shmoes like you have meaning only in relation to the rich, to the powerful, to ME!

question: If you pull this off, I can't promise I won't kill you. I mean, who we trying to kid? But I will spare the Flying Nun here....
answer: And to think I thought you were Evil Incarnate in pumps.

question: I killed some lovable working class Italian-diabetic, but you killed the most significant male figure of the decade and a kind, gentle lover. So don't play with me.
answer: Okay, fine!

question: Oh Hawk, don't ever change. Go, team, go!
answer: I hope you know what....

question: murmurs to Hawk. Da Vinci made the real directions in a secret script that I decoded. The way the machine is running now, the gold will produce too quickly, clog, and the machine will shut itself down. Isn't it wonderful?
answer: Yeah, but what would happen if that little mirror came out of the crystal.

question: Wha -- you don't want to know...
answer: I wanna know...

question: Me, Anna, and Leonardo just wanna say you got the Midas touch, baby...
answer: How.

question: You're unemployed, Alfie. Boss is dead. Her plan is over.
answer: My plan is just beginning. I'll forgive you for denying me the pleasure of slaughtering my boorish employers, but I'm afraid the birth of the new British Empire can have no witnesses!
